oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1956-11-10 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from November 10, 1956. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Roy Acuff (host/performer) with his Smoky Mountain Boys, guest performers Johnnie & Jack with Ray Crisp and Kitty Wells, and regular performers the Jordanaires, Howdy Forrester, Pap's Jug Band, Minnie Pearl, and Bashful Brother Oswald. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that the 5th annual DJ convention is taking place.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; Jordanaires; Johnnie & Jack; Ray Crisp; Howdy Forrester; Pap's Jug Band
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Roy Acuff -- I Couldn't Believe It Was True (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) -- Roy Acuff introduces the Jordanaires -- Dig A Little Deeper (Jordanaires) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Roy Acuff) -- Roy Acuff introduces Johnnie & Jack and Ray Crisp -- Live And Let Live (Johnnie & Jack, Ray Crisp) -- Roy Acuff introduces Howdy Forrester and Ray Crisp -- Sugar In The Gourd (Howdy Forrester fiddle, Ray Crisp fiddle) -- Roy Acuff talks -- Shake My Mother's Hand For Me (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Roy Acuff) -- Prince Albert jingle -- Roy Acuff introduces the Jug Band -- Thirty Days (Pap's Jug Band)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Minnie Pearl; Jordanaires (Musical group); Miller, Mitch; Bashful Brother Oswald; Pap's Jug Band; Forrester, Howdy, 1922-1987; Riddle, Jimmy, 1918-1982; Crisp, Ray; Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; Johnnie & Jack; Wright, Johnnie, 1914-2011; Anglin, Jack, 1916-1963; Wells, Kitty
